required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: (ACORD Study) - A Study of NeoRecormon (Epoetin Beta) in Patients With Early Diabetic Nephropathy
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Randomized, Multi-centre Trial to Investigate the Effect of Anemia Correction on Cardiac Structure and Function in Patients With Early Diabetic Nephropathy

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the effect of anemia correction with NeoRecormon on cardiac structure and function in patients with early diabetic nephropathy. The anticipated time on study treatment is 1-2 years and the target sample size is 100-500 individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Left Ventricle Mass Index (LVMI) at Month 15
primary_outcome.description: LVMI (in g/m^2) = (0.8 [1.04 {(LVEDD + IVS + PWT)^3 - (LVEDD)^3}] + 0.6) divided by BSA. Here, LVEDD = left ventricular end diastolic diameter (in centimeters [cm]); PWT = left ventricular posterior wall thickness in diastole (in cm); IVS = interventricular septal wall thickness in diastole (in cm). Echocardiogram was performed at baseline and Month 15 to interpret LVMI which was expressed in grams per meter square (g/m^2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume Index (LVESVI)
secondary_outcome.description: LVESVI was calculated by dividing left ventricular end systolic volume (LVESV) (in milliliters [mL]) with body surface area (BSA) (in meter square [m^2]). LVESVI is presented in milliliter per meter square (mL/m^2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume Index (LVEDVI)
secondary_outcome.description: LVEDVI was calculated by dividing left ventricular end diastolic volume (LVEDV) (in mL) BSA (in m^2). LVEDVI was presented in mL/m^2.

FS was calculated as: ([LVEDD - LVESD] divided by LVEDV) multiplied by 100; where LVEDD = left ventricular end diastolic diameter (in centimeters [cm]), LVESD = left ventricular end systolic diameter (in cm), LVEDV = left ventricular end diastolic volume (in mL). FS is expressed in percentage of LVEDV.

LVEF was calculated as ([LVEDV - LVESV], divided by LVEDV) multiplied by 100; where LVEDV = left ventricular end diastolic volume (in mL), LVESV = left ventricular end systolic volume (in mL). LVEF is expressed in percentage of LVEDV.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Stable Hb Levels Between 13 to 15 g/dL

arm_group.description: Along with their standard treatment participants will receive epoetin beta at a starting dose of 2000 International Units (IU) subcutaneously (SC) once weekly to reach and maintain target hemoglobin (Hb) between 13 and 15 grams per deciliter (g/dL), for 15 months. Epoetin beta doses will be adjusted according to individual participant's Hb level. Standard treatment will be as per investigator discretion.

Participants will receive their standard treatment for 15 months but no treatment for anemia correction unless Hb level will be less than (<) 10.5 g/dL on 2 consecutive visits of 2 weeks interval or the Hb level will be <10 g/dL on a single determination. In such cases participants could receive epoetin beta at a starting dose of 2000 IU SC once weekly to reach and maintain a target Hb level of 10.5 to 11.5 g/dL. Standard treatment will be as per investigator discretion.

group.title: Group 1 (Early Epoetin Beta)
group.description: Along with their standard treatment participants received epoetin beta at a starting dose of 2000 International Units (IU) subcutaneously (SC) once weekly to reach and maintain target hemoglobin (Hb) between 13 and 15 grams per deciliter (g/dL), for 15 months. Epoetin beta doses were adjusted according to individual participant’s Hb level. Standard treatment was as per investigator discretion.

group.title: Group 2 (No/Late Epoetin Beta)
group.description: Participants received their standard treatment for 15 months but no treatment for anemia correction unless Hb level was less than (<) 10.5 g/dL on 2 consecutive visits of 2 weeks interval or the Hb level was <10 g/dL on a single determination. In such cases participants could receive epoetin beta at a starting dose of 2000 IU SC once weekly to reach and maintain a target Hb level of 10.5 to 11.5 g/dL. Standard treatment was as per investigator discretion.

baseline.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Group 1 (Early Epoetin Beta)
group.description: Along with their standard treatment participants received epoetin beta at a starting dose of 2000 IU SC once weekly to reach and maintain target Hb between 13 and 15 g/dL, for 15 months. Epoetin beta doses were adjusted according to individual participant’s Hb level. Standard treatment was as per investigator discretion.

group.title: Group 2 (No/Late Epoetin Beta)
group.description: Participants received their standard treatment for 15 months but no treatment for anemia correction unless Hb level was <10.5 g/dL on 2 consecutive visits of 2 weeks interval or the Hb level was <10 g/dL on a single determination. In such cases participants could receive epoetin beta at a starting dose of 2000 IU SC once weekly to reach and maintain a target Hb level of 10.5 to 11.5 g/dL. Standard treatment was as per investigator discretion.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Left Ventricle Mass Index (LVMI) at Month 15
outcome.description: LVMI (in g/m^2) = (0.8 [1.04 {(LVEDD + IVS + PWT)^3 – (LVEDD)^3}] + 0.6) divided by BSA. Here, LVEDD = left ventricular end diastolic diameter (in centimeters [cm]); PWT = left ventricular posterior wall thickness in diastole (in cm); IVS = interventricular septal wall thickness in diastole (in cm). Echocardiogram was performed at baseline and Month 15 to interpret LVMI which was expressed in grams per meter square (g/m^2).
outcome.population: ITT population. Here, number of participants analyzed = participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Left Ventricle Mass Index (LVMI) at Month 15
measure.description: LVMI (in g/m^2) = (0.8 [1.04 {(LVEDD + IVS + PWT)^3 – (LVEDD)^3}] + 0.6) divided by BSA. Here, LVEDD = left ventricular end diastolic diameter (in centimeters [cm]); PWT = left ventricular posterior wall thickness in diastole (in cm); IVS = interventricular septal wall thickness in diastole (in cm). Echocardiogram was performed at baseline and Month 15 to interpret LVMI which was expressed in grams per meter square (g/m^2).
measure.population: ITT population. Here, number of participants analyzed = participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value was calculated by ANCOVA with last observation carry forward (LOCF) method.

outcome.title: Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume Index (LVESVI)
outcome.description: LVESVI was calculated by dividing left ventricular end systolic volume (LVESV) (in milliliters [mL]) with body surface area (BSA) (in meter square [m^2]). LVESVI is presented in milliliter per meter square (mL/m^2).
outcome.population: ITT population. Here, number of participants analyzed = participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure. Here “n”= participants who were evaluable for each category, for respective arm groups.

reported_events.time_frame: up to 30 days after last study drug administration (35 months)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
